questions.question: He told me ……………………… interesting story yesterday.
questions.description: Use a/an to mean one. A singular countable noun requires an article.

questions.question: He has ………………….. keen eye for detail.
……………………. life is complicated.
questions.description: We do not normally use an article with uncountable nouns when we are talking about things in general.

questions.question: …………………… minister ordered ………………………. official inquiry into ……………………… incident.
He has no interest in …………………….. politics.
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with the names of subjects.

questions.question: She learned ………………………… philosophy at university.
questions.description: We do not normally use articles with the names of subjects.

questions.question: Raju is …………………….. accomplished cook. ………………………. dinner he gave us yesterday was delicious.
................................ suspect was taken into …………………………. custody.
questions.description: Suspect is a singular countable noun we have to use an article with singular countable nouns there is no article in the expression take into custody.

questions.question: …………………………. person who died in ……………………… riot was ……………………. social activist.
questions.description: We use the to identify someone. A/an is an indefinite article and it does not mention who we are talking about.

questions.question: …………………….. tea is very strong. Please pour some more milk into it.
What ……………………… pity that you failed ……………………….. test.
questions.description: The correct expression is what a pity.
